===Etymology===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|おく}}
Despite the apparent overlap with the modern [[呉音#Japanese|''goon'']] reading of ''oku'' that is derived from {{etyl|ltc|-}}, this term is actually rooted in {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=おく}}, appearing in the ''{{w|Man'yōshū}}'' collection of poetry dating to roughly 759 CE.  Cognate with {{m|ja|沖|tr=oki||the open sea, offshore}}, originally in reference to “somewhere far removed, possibly out of sight”.  While ''oki'' came to mean “far removed in the wide open → far off shore”, ''oku'' instead came to mean “far removed inside → inside, interior”.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>
